btw one thing, You need to test each planet and moon becuase when i tryed to land on hoth my ship exploded on contact. You need to make sure each world works before going on to the next one.

Wait...

Wut.

WORMHOLES?!?!?

I'm already making a vessel worthy of making it to a moon of another nearby star system and back to kerbin to land. Plus its actually not overkill. Message me for a picture of it, even though i doubt anyone would be interested.

drill a hole in the ground and put a worm in it to have one of your own ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

New version has been released!

Your mod is just awesome ! Very big thanks for your works !
Oh... Imgur is offline. I can't see your images, Artyomka15.
How the heck in all honesty did you make a wormhole!?!?! Seriously? how did you?
Someone better make a new review of this! its getting awesome!!!
If I add this to my modded save which already has OPM, will the OPM planets fit inside kerbol's SOI?

Okay, so, this is, in my humble opinion, the most awesome planet pack I've ever seen. I mean, wormholes! That being said, I'm curious as to the long term plans for this mod. Do you have biomes in mind for the current moons and planets? Also, do you have a set number of stars, planets, or moons you plan to include?

While I'm here, I had a couple of ideas I wanted to throw out there:

A cluster of small bodies, ranging in size from smaller than Gilly to the size of Minmus, with similarly sized spheres of influence. These objects would be closer to each other than the Mun is to Kerbin, but on their own, unique and technically independent orbits around their star. The thing that makes them remain in a cluster would be the fact that they all have identical orbital periods. Their orbits are just slightly differently placed, with maybe one or two being longer and thinner than the others, so, while they undulate around each other, they remain in close proximity none the less.

A star system on an extremely eccentric orbit around the galactic center, making it particularly difficult to get to.

A pulsar or magnetar system, with the pulsar being a strobe light star, and the magnetar disallowing transmissions while in it's Sphere of Influence. Not certain if these are accurate interpretation of these kind of celestial bodies, but I think they would be fun.

A star system with five or six captured satellites, each with a strange, wildly eccentric orbit.

A planet using the color scheme: white stone land, black tar oceans, and sparse, purple iodine clouds. I would imagine it would have a thin atmosphere and be hot (close to it's parent star) to have iodine gas as said atmosphere.
Suggestion for the Wormhole, instead of a black hole, get a starfield and map it to a globe and use that as the texture.

> 
> If I add this to my modded save which already has OPM, will the OPM planets fit inside kerbol's SOI?

No, KerbalGalaxy mod has not developed for OPM. Outer planets will rotate around Kerbol, but your spacecraft won't be able to come to these planets being at orbit of Kerbol.
OPM works with this, you just have to go into the config and reparent the OPM Planets from "Sun" to "Kerbol" Although the outermost planet's orbit nearly intersects that of the closest star.
anybody getting an issue where the sky is pitch black? any tips on remedying this?

> 
> anybody getting an issue where the sky is pitch black? any tips on remedying this?

I am assuming you mean in map view. If so, then it's a different skybox. It you look around, you'll see a few galaxies here and there. I think the idea is to make distant objects pop out more, and maybe to fill the sky with stars.

> 
> I am assuming you mean in map view. If so, then it's a different skybox. It you look around, you'll see a few galaxies here and there. I think the idea is to make distant objects pop out more, and maybe to fill the sky with stars.

Yes sirree your right ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) In fact i created the skybox ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) If you want the skybox on its own [Download Here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/109729-Daniels-Intergalactic-Skybox) ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

btw Artyomka you kinda need to slow your pace, Many planets glitch and destroy ships when attempting to land, please take more time to ensure each planet works properly ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Improved wormhole (Coming soon):

![8hSWX8I.gif](http://i.imgur.com/8hSWX8I.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-11T11:01:38Z" title="07/11/2015 11:01  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 11, 2015</time> by Artyomka15**

> 
> What's the RAM usage on this pack?

Not bad at all. I was afraid of downloading it myself because I was already running KSP with only 3GB of RAM, but I gave it a shot, and, insanely, my game actually runs *better* now. I assume it's because the skybox was eating up my RAM before.

Also, I agree with danie l. It's better to make people wait for a few weeks and make sure everything runs perfectly, than to release a pretty-looking load of junk in a couple of days. That being said, maybe you could get a couple of forum users to go through your coding and refine the coding. I have no knowledge of how to do that, myself, but, danie l might be able to help.
The problem with this skybox is that since everything is generally on the same plane, you're going to have a line of stars and then a big empty space until we start getting some weirder orbits.

> 
> Improved wormhole (Coming soon):
